instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> 3.42
LCD connector looked good and no shorts
PP5...?..<SIGNAL>SW_LCD</SIGNAL> 5v
<CHIP>U9701</CHIP> Pin 23 5v, Pin 3.3v

Recently on 2 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> I replaced <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> for no image and both are working good now, I am wondering if replacing <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> wil fix it on this one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
Do you get USB activity for sure?
If not, then is no reason to search for video...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message: Yes there is USB activity and post sound, no image

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
Missing backlight and image at same time?
Do you get <SIGNAL>LCD_HPD</SIGNAL>?
Any voltage at pin 1/J9000?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
Have backlight, no image.
J9000 Pin 1 40v bad screen cable or bad screen maybe? [LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]<SIGNAL>LCD_HPD</SIGNAL> 2.8v[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
Check all C902x caps and their traces.
Also check AUX strapping resistors and all R901x.

40V is OK there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message: All caps and resistors are good and traces fine, not sure what [COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]AUX strapping resistors are.[/FONT][/COLOR]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
Did you try known good compatible LCD assembly?

"not sure what [COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]AUX strapping resistors are"
What happens if you search for "AUX strapping" in pdf?[/FONT][/COLOR]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
I don't have anotherone of those LCDs, I have a late 2013 but with that one same problem.
When I search for  [LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]AUX strapping I get results, thanks![/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message: The problem is the facetime camera on the LCD or the board, when that cable is disconnected the Mac works just fine, I will be checking out that circuit and see if we can fix it without replacing the screen. If you have any pointers on how to address that please let me know.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
Could be ALS issue.
Cut off traces from pins 5/6 of J3502.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message: With no connection on pins 5/6 same problem

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message: Try another webcam, to locate the problem.
